cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-north-east toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City–Terrebonne Parish area, LA (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds 35–45 mph with higher gusts likely beginning this evening and persisting through Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–3 ft of surge possible along the Plaquemines coastal sections and lower Mississippi River Delta during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches widespread with isolated totals up to 12 inches, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible during rain bands.
